availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joel C. Bussey (Bath County, preacher and soldier)

body.p: Owingsville, Kentucky, preacher and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Sarah Bussey. Preacher in Owingsville in 1860. Served in Captain Busseyâ€™s Company (Bath County Rangers) of the Kentucky State Militia as a captain from December 11, 1863 to April 1, 1864. Served in 1st Regiment Capital Guards of the Kentucky State Militia from February 1, 1864 to June 28, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 5.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 760 and 887.
